p: Among the volatile components accounting for > 0.1% of the % GC area, α‐thujene, (E)‐α‐bergamotene and l‐fenchone have not been previously assessed for use as flavourings. The FEEDAP Panel notes that they are aliphatic mono‐ or sesquiterpenes structurally related to flavourings already assessed in CG 31 and 8 and a similar metabolic and toxicological profile is expected. These lipophilic compounds are expected to be rapidly absorbed from the gastro‐intestinal tract, oxidised to polar oxygenated metabolites, conjugated and excreted (EFSA FEEDAP Panel, 2016c, d). The compounds were screened with the Organization for Economic Co‐operation and Development (OECD) Quantitative Structure–Activity Relationship (QSAR) Toolbox and no alert were identified for in vitro mutagenicity, for genotoxic and non‐genotoxic carcinogenicity and for other endpoints. 13
